data.title: Actor.draw is displaying a grey rectangle
FreeTypeFontGenerator can't load few japanese characters from ttf font
Array.sort(Comparator<T>) does not produce results consistant with ArrayList.sort(Comparator<T>) when used with the default ModelCache.Sorter
Using OrthographicCamera.combined as the projection matrix results in text rendering problems
data.body:
#### Issue details

I use an Orthographic Camera in my project with the width equal to 720 pixels and the height 1280 pixels, I then use the OrthographicCamera.combined matrix as the projection matrix in my SpriteBatch. All textures scale fine but the fonts look weird. After hours of testing I manage to figure out that it is because of the combined matrix because when I comment the line SpriteBatch.setProjectionMatrix(Camera.combined) the text renders fine, but it does not scale my app to different screen sizes.  I tested it on Android too though and the text looked better on my phone (except for one italic font which also looked weird), I thought this was because the phone is of a resolution higher than 720p but that does not seem to be the case since running the Desktop version of my app in 720p does not help the text render any better.

![5bd2d13daa705f214c2dda965e852921](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15983269/16713971/cf3f30f6-46be-11e6-9992-7db121aafc72.png)
Text rendering with problems when using combined matrix.

![dab1f148f91b1ffc8a51d9a82d15eab0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15983269/16713967/b7eb4b74-46be-11e6-8db5-fc191d06396f.png)
Text rendering fine without combined matrix.
#### Reproduction steps/code

Create a font using the FreeTypeFontGenerator with Linear min and mag filters.
Create a Sprite Batch and a OrthographicCamera.
Set the Sprite Batch projection matrix to Camera.combined.
Render the text.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

_Lib Gdx version 1.9.2_
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [X] Android
- [X] Windows
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: TurnBasedGame with libGDX + Google Play Services
Can not load default BitmapFont to AssetManager.
data.body:
Without AssetManager you can do `new BitmapFont();`, which will load default font, provided with library. And if you are using AssetManager, it is not possible to load default font easily.
How to load default font, provided with library into AssetManager?

data.title: Suggestion: Gdx.files.internal vs. local / android vs. desktop
data.body:
I used gdx-setup.jar to create an android/desktop-project for AndroidStudio.
This will result in a shared assets-folder for both modules (pointing to android/assets). This is great.
To make this work, gdx-setup.jar sets the working directory of the desktop module to the android assets folder.

But this will result in a problem:
When I'm using the desktop-module for testing (started from within AndroidStudio) and I want to save some data, I use Gdx.files.local (as suggested).

But: On desktop this will write these files to the assets folder, because that's the current working directory!
When I later compile the android-project, AS will pack these written files into the APK.
But I don't want these files in the APK.
To fix this, I currently prefix the local-path on desktop with "../../", so it will write the data in the project-root instead of the assets folder. But this is a slightly inconvenient solution.

A more convenient behaviour would be very helpful.
If there is an easier way to accomplish this via the current libgdx, please tell me.

data.title: Added support to window icon on LWJGL3 backend
data.body:
Now that GLFW has the glfwSetWindowIcon() method, I added support to window icon on LWJGL3 backend.
I tried to be as close as possible to LWJGL backend implementation.
I've tested with icons on png, jpg and bmp formats. But only on Windows.
I am not sure if the best place to put the GLFW.glfwSetWindowIcon() call is in the Lwjgl3Graphics constructor. Any suggestion?

data.title: Suggestion: don't ignore screenX and screenY while updating Viewports
data.body:
[badlogicgames forum topic: Viewport.update() ignores screenX and screenY](http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=22932)

I started this issue for the suggestion made in #3681.

Currently I'm working on [Viewports for BDX](https://github.com/GoranM/bdx/issues/701). The behavior of LibGDX viewports as being described in this issue is causing some inconveniences. First there's the necessity to set `screenX` and `screenY` and call `apply()` after calling `update()` and secondly some of the Viewport types, such as FitViewport, won't update correctly so `screenX`, `screenY`, `screenWidth` and `screenHeight` had to be recalculated. These issues made me consider not to utilize LibGDX Viewports, but maybe that wouldn't be necessary.

@nooone mentioned that the current behavior of LibGDX Viewports is intended because they ought to be positioned at the center of the screen, when updated. I would like to suggest to change this behavior so Viewports, such us ExtendViewport, StretchViewport and FitViewport (ScalingViewports) are centered relatively to their position and size. Also ScreenViewport wouldn't always be at the left bottom corner. The old behavior would still apply if the position would be (0, 0) and the size would be the same as the size of the screen.

data.title: Avoid creating LIBGDX Window on create method
Warning: Class 'com.foo.DesktopLauncher' not found in module 'desktop' immediately after following setup directions
data.body:
#### Issue details

I followed the instructions at https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Project-Setup-Gradle so I have a brand new, blank libgdx project. I am now attempting to follow the instructions at https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Gradle-and-Intellij-IDEA to run this blank program. I am using IntelliJ and am getting stuck at the Running Your Project -> Desktop section.

If I follow the steps described, when I select the DesktopLauncher class, there is an error at the bottom of the window saying "Warning: Class 'com.foo.DesktopLauncher' not found in module 'desktop'". I can't seem to get around this. If I click Apply then Ok, then attempt to run, the program crashes with the same error in a stack trace:

``` java
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.foo.DesktopLauncher
    at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:381)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:424)
    at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:331)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357)
    at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
    at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:264)
    at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:122)
```

It is interesting to note that when I click on the button to choose the main class, it does not appear under the Search By Name list. It is a selection of 30 classes in the standard sun library, starting with the letters A-C. If I set "Use classpath of module" to <no module>, my main class DOES appear under the Main class -> Search by Name list. But, it won't run without choosing a module.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

I'm not exactly sure what version of LibGDX I'm using, but I downloaded the jar from the Download Setup App link at https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/download.html on Saturday, June 25th. I am using IntelliJ CE 2016.1.3
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)

This does not affect any of the computers I tested it on but I have received multiple error reports from users unable to launch my project on their computer in fullscreen. Looking up the error gives me decade old forum posts that don't really help, one of which suggested disabling fullscreen for the error to disappear and that does indeed make it work. But that's more like an ugly patch workaround, not really a fix.

data.title: Html5 GwtGL20 bug
data.body:
#### Issue details

There is a issue with shadows/DepthShader that the get attribute in DefaultShader.java is returning null and giving a error at https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9e88159b4fb98c1991fc8df49d0c236e8749ff7a/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g3d/shaders/DefaultShader.java#L226  

This is a old bug that happened with GWT bullet extension when running Bullet collection test on browser. The error happens when running a test that have multiple shadow models. The error was first logged here (https://echelog.com/logs/browse/libgdx/1451862000  Time: [15:11:56] ) and then here (https://echelog.com/logs/browse/libgdx/1453676400 Time: [01:11:24])  

Stacktrace: screenshot: http://imgur.com/wYwMLP3

@Xoppa quickfix was to comment everything at this line (https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9e88159b4fb98c1991fc8df49d0c236e8749ff7a/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g3d/shaders/DepthShader.java#L120-L136) and call super.canRender(). That worked, it fixed the error. 

Im porting Bullet test collection to work for Dragome and the same error happens and the "super.canRender" quick fix also works but not the current canRender code.

Dragome demo with quickfix: [BulletTestCollection](http://xpenatan.github.io/gdx-dragome-backend/index.html?BulletCollection)

Note: Dragome backend have the same code as GWT backend so if it doesn't work with GWT it wont for Dragome.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.3 nightlies 
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [X] HTML/GWT/Dragome
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Fix LWJGL graphics backend issues.
data.body:
- Add resizable/undecorated options to LWJGL config.
- Add 'forceDisplayModeChange' flag in LwjglGraphics to force 'setWindowedMode' to reconfigure the Display after a call to 'setUndecorated'

See #3956 for past submission.

data.title: Lwjgl3 various graphics fixes
data.body:
This PR aims to fix #4141, #4142 and #4143.

I also added support to enable OpenGL debug message callbacks. Made debugging a lot easier.

Note: these changes do not fix fullscreen transitions on OS X (with Retina displays) - see https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/748 and https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/682.
